column4: can someone with good all around knowledge about ubuntu pm me please
well i want to know if i switch to ubuntu will it mess with any of my current files and what not..
and i make the complete switch how will it be working?
i just dont want it to interfere with my music files..
you can non-destructively resize your windows partitions
when you install grub (the boot loader, that loads the OS) it will make ubuntu the default OS. you'll still HAVE windows, but ubuntu will boot by default
: ok so i want to install but dont want to open up a partition or whatever..

ubuntu requires a few hundred megabytes, and until it's installed you need another OS. once it's installed you can delete windows, but until then you need it. backup some of your music and restore it later
how much space do you have free? as i said before you can non-destructively resize your partition
i only have 149 total hdd space atm
i will find out right now exactly how much i have left
that's fine for now. don't PM people without asking. use the ubuntu installer to resize your partition, install ubuntu on that new partition, delete the OS from your old partition
or you don't need to delete the old OS at all, both will be loadable (as per your PM question)
it's like telemarketers, or that guy in your office who calls you for every little issue
the hassle would be Press Esc during the boot and choose Windows XP from the menu
